title: x/talks: printout of slides does not include code
body:
Visit http://talks.golang.org/2013/advconc.slide in Chrome
File > Print
Look through preview of printout: the code boxes are empty.
Cancel print.

Arrow-right until you get to a page with code boxes (like page #6).
See that they are filled in.

File > Print
Look through preview of printout: all code boxes, even after that page, now contain code.

It appears that something about flipping through the talk populates the code boxes on
demand? Perhaps this can be done at page load so that printing from slide 1 will work.


Google Chrome	 30.0.1599.69 (Official Build 226629) 
OS	Mac OS X 
Blink	537.36 (@158213)
JavaScript	V8 3.20.17.13
Flash	 11.9.900.117
User Agent	Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_8_5) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML,
like Gecko) Chrome/30.0.1599.69 Safari/537.36
Command Line	 /Applications/Google Chrome.app/Contents/MacOS/Google Chrome
-psn_0_20652977 --flag-switches-begin --flag-switches-end
Executable Path	/Applications/Google Chrome.app/Contents/MacOS/Google Chrome
